section.heading: Scope
section.text: This chapter governs ALS education programs approved by the EMS Board which have been approved to provide education in specialty care transport.

para.text: In order to be approved to provide a specialty care transport education course, an education program shall:
Meet all requirements for an ALS education program found in COMAR 30.04.02 except for the requirement in COMAR 30.04.02.12F(2)(d) to conduct at least one full length ALS course every 2 years;
Have a medical director who, in addition to the other requirements for medical directors in COMAR 30.04.02.06B:
Has education and experience in the care of critically ill patients; and
Use a curriculum which has been approved by the EMS Board; and
Meet the requirements of COMAR 30.04.02; and
Have additional education, experience, and expertise in the care and transport of a critically ill patient.

annotations.annotation: Education Article, §§13-509 and 13-516, Annotated Code of Maryland
